docs.title: Vindicta Core
docs.text:
The foundation layer for the Vindicta ecosystem.

Vindicta Core provides shared primitives, configuration management, and interface contracts used across all Vindicta Platform modules.

docs.title: Why Vindicta Core?
docs.text:
Building a modular platform requires a stable foundation. Vindicta Core is that foundation:

  • Zero Dependencies on Other Modules — Core depends on nothing else
  • Stable Interfaces — Breaking changes require major version bumps
  • Minimal Surface Area — Only essential utilities exposed

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: uv pip install git+https://github.com/vindicta-platform/Vindicta-Core.git

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
from vindicta_core import PlatformSettings

settings = PlatformSettings()
print(f"Environment: {settings.environment}")
print(f"Debug Mode: {settings.debug}")

docs.title: What's Included
docs.text: Module Purpose config Pydantic-based settings management models Shared data models and schemas interfaces Abstract contracts for cross-module communication state Platform-wide state primitives

docs.title: Part of the Vindicta Platform
docs.text: Vindicta Core is one module in the larger Vindicta Platform. Use it standalone, or as part of the full ecosystem.

docs.title: PlatformSettings
docs.text:
Pydantic-based settings with environment variable support.

class PlatformSettings(BaseSettings):
    environment: str = "development"
    debug: bool = False
    database_url: str = "sqlite:///vindicta.db"
    log_level: str = "INFO"

docs.title: BaseEntity
docs.text:
Base class for all domain entities.

class BaseEntity(BaseModel):
    id: UUID
    created_at: datetime
    updated_at: datetime

docs.title: IRepository
docs.text:
Abstract base for data access.

class IRepository(ABC, Generic[T]):
    @abstractmethod
    async def get(self, id: UUID) -> T | None: ...

    @abstractmethod
    async def save(self, entity: T) -> T: ...

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Default Description VINDICTA_ENV development Environment name VINDICTA_DEBUG false Enable debug mode DATABASE_URL sqlite:///vindicta.db Database connection LOG_LEVEL INFO Logging verbosity

docs.title: .env File
docs.text:
Create a .env file in your project root:

VINDICTA_ENV=production
VINDICTA_DEBUG=false
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:pass@localhost/vindicta
LOG_LEVEL=WARNING

docs.title: Programmatic Override
docs.text:
from vindicta_core import PlatformSettings

    environment="testing",
    debug=True
)

docs.title: ADR-001: Python as Primary Language
docs.text: Status: Accepted Date: 2026-02-01

docs.title: Context
docs.text: This repository requires a programming language for implementation. The choice affects developer experience, ecosystem compatibility, and maintenance burden.

docs.title: Decision
docs.text: We adopt Python 3.10+ as the primary language.

docs.title: Rationale
docs.text:
• Ecosystem Alignment — Vindicta Platform is Python-first
  • Tooling — Rich ecosystem (pytest, ruff, mypy)
  • Async Support — Native async/await for I/O operations
  • Type Safety — Full type hints with Pydantic

docs.title: Alternatives Considered
docs.text: Alternative Pros Cons Decision TypeScript Strong types, web-native Different ecosystem, adds complexity Rejected Rust Performance, safety Higher learning curve, slower iteration Rejected Go Concurrency, simple Less expressive, limited ecosystem Rejected

docs.title: Consequences
docs.text:
• All source code in src/ uses Python 3.10+
  • Type hints required on all public APIs
  • Ruff for linting/formatting

docs.title: ADR-002: Pre-commit Hooks Required
docs.text: Status: Accepted Date: 2026-02-01

docs.title: Context
docs.text: Code quality and consistency require enforcement before commits reach the repository.

docs.title: Decision
docs.text: All repositories MUST configure pre-commit hooks.

docs.title: Required Hooks
docs.text:
repos:
  - repo: https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff-pre-commit
    rev: v0.4.0
    hooks:
      - id: ruff
        args: [--fix]
      - id: ruff-format
  - repo: https://github.com/pre-commit/pre-commit-hooks
    rev: v4.5.0
    hooks:
      - id: trailing-whitespace
      - id: end-of-file-fixer
      - id: check-yaml

docs.title: Alternatives Considered
docs.text: Alternative Pros Cons Decision CI-only Simpler setup Late feedback Rejected Husky (JS) Popular Different ecosystem Rejected Manual Zero config Inconsistent Rejected

docs.title: Consequences
docs.text:
• .pre-commit-config.yaml required in all repos
  • Developers must run pre-commit install after clone
  • CI will also run pre-commit as verification
